pullRequest.title: GH-2538 Standalone Model API
pullRequest.bodyText:
GitHub issue resolved: #2538
Briefly describe the changes proposed in this PR:

created rdf4j-model-api maven module with no external dependencies
added rdf4j-model-api module as a dependency to rdf4j-model module

tweaked  rdf4j-model description


removed references to rdf4j-model classes from javadocs in org.eclipse.rdf4.model interfaces
migrated org.eclipse.rdf4.model test classes to org.eclipse.rdf4.model.impl

renamed ValueFactoryTest to SimpleValueFactoryTest


added default implementation of compareTo() to Namespace
replaced SimpleNamespace dependency in Model with lightweight  read-only package-local BasicNamespace implementation
migrated org.eclipse.rdf4j.common.annotation package to rdf4j-model-api module to allow @Experimental annotation of Triple interface

seems to make sense as long as other annotations are not added, as @Experimental/@InternalUseOnly relate mainly to APIs


migrated org.eclipse.rdf4j.model package to rdf4j-model-api module


PR Author Checklist (see the contributor guidelines for more details):

[ x] my pull request is self-contained
[ x] I've added tests for the changes I made
[ x] I've applied code formatting (you can use mvn process-resources to format from the command line)
[x ] every commit message starts with the issue number (GH-xxxx) followed by a meaningful description of the change
[ x] every commit has been signed off

Note: we merge all feature pull requests using squash and merge. See RDF4J git merge strategy for more details.

nodes.bodyText: Your IDE forgot to substitute the number here. Also: I don't think we should replace the license header on this just because we moved the file.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1,10 +1,10 @@
 /*******************************************************************************
- * Copyright (c) 2015 Eclipse RDF4J contributors, Aduna, and others.
+ * Copyright (c) ${year} Eclipse RDF4J contributors.

nodes.bodyText: good catch. I had to look several times before I even realized what you had changed.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -30,7 +27,7 @@
 	 *
 	 * @param iri A string-representation of a IRI.
 	 * @return An object representing the IRI.
-	 * @throws IlllegalArgumentException If the supplied string does not resolve to a legal (absolute) IRI.
+	 * @throws IllegalArgumentException If the supplied string does not resolve to a legal (absolute) IRI.

nodes.bodyText: This is a new file I think? If so this is the wrong header.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,27 @@
+/*******************************************************************************
+ * Copyright (c) 2015 Eclipse RDF4J contributors, Aduna, and others.
+ * All rights reserved. This program and the accompanying materials

nodes.bodyText: Wildcard import needs to be expanded.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,27 @@

+ * Copyright (c) 2015 Eclipse RDF4J contributors, Aduna, and others.
+ * All rights reserved. This program and the accompanying materials
+ * are made available under the terms of the Eclipse Distribution License v1.0

+import org.eclipse.rdf4j.model.*;

nodes.bodyText: This won't work unless the model-api module actually produces and publishes a test jar. I'm not sure yet if that is desirable - we use this approach in one other place (the rio api) but for everything else we have set up separate test suite projects instead. I'll take a look at this and if necessary refactor.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -8,13 +8,25 @@
 	</parent>
 	<artifactId>rdf4j-model</artifactId>
 	<name>RDF4J: Model</name>
-	<description>RDF model interfaces and implementations.</description>
+	<description>RDF model implementations.</description>
 	<dependencies>
+		<dependency>
+			<groupId>${project.groupId}</groupId>
+			<artifactId>rdf4j-model-api</artifactId>
+			<version>${project.version}</version>
+		</dependency>
 		<dependency>
 			<groupId>${project.groupId}</groupId>
 			<artifactId>rdf4j-util</artifactId>
 			<version>${project.version}</version>
 		</dependency>
+		<dependency>
+			<groupId>${project.groupId}</groupId>
+			<artifactId>rdf4j-model-api</artifactId>
+			<version>${project.version}</version>
+			<type>test-jar</type>

nodes.bodyText:
This class, and the other new abstract classes, could use a minimal bit of Javadoc. All it really needs:

Base class for {@link BNode}, offering common functionality.

and preferable an author tag, and a @since 3.5.0 tag as well.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,40 @@
+/*******************************************************************************
+ * Copyright (c) 2020 Eclipse RDF4J contributors.
+ * All rights reserved. This program and the accompanying materials
+ * are made available under the terms of the Eclipse Distribution License v1.0
+ * which accompanies this distribution, and is available at
+ * http://www.eclipse.org/org/documents/edl-v10.php.
+ ******************************************************************************/
+
+package org.eclipse.rdf4j.model.base;
+
+import java.util.Objects;
+
+import org.eclipse.rdf4j.model.BNode;
+
+public abstract class AbstractBNode implements BNode {

nodes.bodyText: Can we move this back into the Literal interface. There is no need to introduce another instanceof call for every Literal again!
This is probably what is causing the test failures. Notice both methods call on leftLit

commit.message: GH-2538 fix bug introduced by merge resolution

nodes.bodyText: Adding new methods to an existing public interface (without a default implementation) is not backwards compatible. It's also out of scope for this issue.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -11,9 +11,20 @@ /** * A namespace, consisting of a namespace name and a prefix that has been assigned to it. + *

+ * Warning / In order to ensure interoperability of concrete classes implementing this interface, + * {@link #equals(Object)} and {@link #hashCode()} methods must be implemented exactly as described in their specs. + * */ public interface Namespace extends Serializable, Comparable { + /** + * Gets the prefix of the current namespace. The default namespace is represented by an empty prefix string. + * + * @return prefix of namespace, or an empty string in case of the default namespace. + */ + public String getPrefix();

nodes.bodyText: This, also, is not backwards compatible. I don't think we need to declare these at the interface level right now to get this to work.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -22,9 +33,23 @@
 	public String getName();
 
 	/**
-	 * Gets the prefix of the current namespace. The default namespace is represented by an empty prefix string.
+	 * Compares this namespace to another object.
 	 *
-	 * @return prefix of namespace, or an empty string in case of the default namespace.
+	 * @param o The object to compare this namespace to
+	 *
+	 * @return {@code true} if the other object is an instance of {@code Namespace} and their {@linkplain #getPrefix()
+	 *         prefixes} and {@linkplain #getName() names} are equal, {@code false} otherwise.
 	 */
-	public String getPrefix();
+	@Override
+	boolean equals(Object o);
+
+	/**
+	 * Computes the hash code of this namespace.
+	 *
+	 * @return a hash code for this namespace computed as {@link java.util.Objects#hash Objects.hash}(
+	 *         {@link #getPrefix()}, {@link #getName()})
+	 */
+	@Override
+	int hashCode();

commit.message: GH-2538 add exception for equals/hashCode methods in API comparison

GH-2538 Add implementation note for Literal.hashCode()

Signed-off-by: Alessandro Bollini <22@metreeca.com>

GH-2538 Revert interface-level equals/hashCode contract for Triple

Signed-off-by: Alessandro Bollini <22@metreeca.com>

nodes.bodyText: I've added this to make sure the test-jar gets produced. I originally wanted to move your abstracts tests to the rdf4j-model-testsuite, but that then results in a circular dependency between rdf4j-model-api and rdf4j-model-testsuite. So let's go with the test-jar approach instead.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,31 @@
+<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
+<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 http://maven.apache.org/maven-v4_0_0.xsd">
+	<modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>
+	<parent>
+		<groupId>org.eclipse.rdf4j</groupId>
+		<artifactId>rdf4j-core</artifactId>
+		<version>3.5.0-SNAPSHOT</version>
+	</parent>
+	<artifactId>rdf4j-model-api</artifactId>
+	<name>RDF4J: Model API</name>
+	<description>RDF model interfaces.</description>
+	<build>
+		<plugins>
+			<plugin>
+				<groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
+				<artifactId>maven-jar-plugin</artifactId>
+				<executions>
+					<execution>
+						<goals>
+							<goal>test-jar</goal>
